FuncDef:
The access-user logout stop-accounting before authentication command enables a device to send Accounting-Stop packets for users in the authentication domain and then authenticate users in the pre-authentication domain during the user logout process.
The undo access-user logout stop-accounting before authentication command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device authenticates users in the pre-authentication domain before sending Accounting-Stop packets for users in the authentication domain during the user logout process.
CLIs: undo access-user logout stop-accounting before authentication
ExtraInfo: To enable a device to send Accounting-Stop packets for users in the authentication domain and then authenticate users in the pre-authentication domain during the user logout process, run the access-user logout stop-accounting before authentication command. The configuration reduces the accounting time error.
